verses.text: And Ahab had seventy sons in Samaria. And Jehu wrote letters, and sent \add to\add* Samaria, unto the rulers of Jezreel, to the elders, and to them that brought up Ahab’s \add children\add*, saying,
Now as soon as this letter cometh to you, seeing your master’s sons \add are\add* with you, and \add there are\add* with you chariots and horses, a fenced city also, and armour;
look even out the best and meetest of your master’s sons, and set \add him\add* on his father’s throne, and fight for your master’s house.
But they were exceedingly afraid, and said, Behold, two kings stood not before him: how then shall we stand?

And \add he\add* that \add was\add* over the house, and \add he\add* that \add was\add* over the city, the elders also, and the bringers up \add of the children\add*, sent to Jehu, saying, We \add are\add* thy servants, and will do all that thou shalt bid us; we will not make any king: do thou \add that\add* which \add is\add* good in thine eyes.

Then he wrote a letter the second time to them, saying, If ye \add be\add* mine, and \add if\add* ye will hearken unto my voice, take ye the heads of the men your master’s sons, and come to me to Jezreel by to morrow \add this\add* time. Now the king’s sons, \add being\add* seventy persons, \add were\add* with the great \add men\add* of the city, which brought them up.
And it came to pass, when the letter came to them, that they took the king’s sons, and slew seventy persons, and put their heads in baskets, and sent him \add them\add* to Jezreel.

And there came a messenger, and told him, saying, They have brought the heads of the king’s sons. And he said, Lay ye them \add in\add* two heaps \add at\add* the entering in of the gate until the morning.
And it came to pass in the morning, that he went out, and stood, and said to all the people, Ye \add be\add* righteous: behold, I conspired against my master, and slew him: but who slew all these?

Know now that there shall fall unto the earth nothing of the word of the \sc Lord\sc*, which the \sc Lord\sc* spake concerning the house of Ahab: for the \sc Lord\sc* hath done \add that\add* which he spake by his servant Elijah.
So Jehu slew all that remained of the house of Ahab in Jezreel, and all his great \add men\add*, and his kinsfolks, and his priests, until \add he\add* left him none remaining.
And he arose and departed, and came \add to\add* Samaria. \add And\add* as he \add was at\add* the shearing house in the way,

Jehu met with the brethren of Ahaziah king of Judah, and said, Who \add are\add* ye? And they answered, We \add are\add* the brethren of Ahaziah; and we go down to salute the children of the king and the children of the queen.
And he said, Take them alive. And they took them alive, and slew them at the pit of the shearing house, \add even\add* two and forty men; neither left he any of them.

And when he was departed thence, he lighted on Jehonadab the son of Rechab \add coming\add* to meet him: and he saluted him, and said to him, Is thine heart right, as my heart \add is\add* with thy heart? And Jehonadab answered, It is. If it be, give \add me\add* thine hand. And he gave \add him\add* his hand; and he took him up to him into the chariot.
And he said, Come with me, and see my zeal for the \sc Lord\sc*. So they made him ride in his chariot.
And when he came \add to\add* Samaria, he slew all that remained unto Ahab in Samaria, till \add he\add* had destroyed him, according to the saying of the \sc Lord\sc*, which he spake to Elijah.
And Jehu gathered all the people together, and said unto them, Ahab served Baal a little; \add but\add* Jehu shall serve him much.

Now therefore call unto me all the prophets of Baal, all his servants, and all his priests; let none be wanting: for I have a great sacrifice \add to do\add* to Baal; whosoever shall be wanting, he shall not live. But Jehu did \add it\add* in subtilty, to the intent that \add he\add* might destroy the worshippers of Baal.
And Jehu said, Proclaim a solemn assembly for Baal. And they proclaimed \add it\add*.

And Jehu sent through all Israel: and all the worshippers of Baal came, so that there was not a man left that came not. And they came \add into\add* the house of Baal; and the house of Baal was full from one end to another.
And he said unto \add him\add* that \add was\add* over the vestry, Bring forth vestments for all the worshippers of Baal. And he brought them forth vestments.

And Jehu went, and Jehonadab the son of Rechab, \add into\add* the house of Baal, and said unto the worshippers of Baal, Search, and look that there be here with you none of the servants of the \sc Lord\sc*, but the worshippers of Baal only.

And when they went in to offer sacrifices and burnt offerings, Jehu appointed fourscore men without, and said, \add If\add* any of the men whom I \add have\add* brought into your hands escape, \add he that letteth him go\add*, his life \add shall be\add* for the life of him.

And it came to pass, as soon as he had made an end of offering the burnt offering, that Jehu said to the guard and to the captains, Go in, \add and\add* slay them; let none come forth. And they smote them with the edge of the sword; and the guard and the captains cast \add them\add* out, and went to the city of the house of Baal.
And they brought forth the images out of the house of Baal, and burnt them.
And they brake down the image of Baal, and brake down the house of Baal, and made it a draught house unto \add this\add* day.
Thus Jehu destroyed Baal out of Israel.

Howbeit \add from\add* the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, who made Israel to sin, Jehu departed not from after them, \add to wit,\add* the golden calves that \add were in\add* Beth-el, and that \add were\add* in Dan.

And the \sc Lord\sc* said unto Jehu, Because thou hast done well in executing \add that\add* which \add is\add* right in mine eyes, \add and\add* hast done unto the house of Ahab according to all that \add was\add* in mine heart, thy children of the fourth \add generation\add* shall sit on the throne of Israel.
But Jehu took no heed to walk in the law of the \sc Lord\sc* God of Israel with all his heart: \add for\add* he departed not from the sins of Jeroboam, which made Israel to sin.
In those days the \sc Lord\sc* began to cut Israel short: and Hazael smote them in all the coasts of Israel;
from Jordan eastward, all the land of Gilead, the Gadites, and the Reubenites, and the Manassites, from Aroer, which \add is\add* by the river Arnon, even Gilead and Bashan.
Now the rest of the acts of Jehu, and all that he did, and all his might, \add are\add* they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
And Jehu slept with his fathers: and they buried him in Samaria. And Jehoahaz his son reigned in his stead.
And the time that Jehu reigned over Israel in Samaria \add was\add* twenty and eight years.
